sentence.text: striated muscle contraction encoding dystrobrevin-a (a-DB) is a putative causal gene associated with left ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy (LVNC).

In conclusion, overexpression of the striated muscle contraction-p.N49S mutation in a mouse heart can be responsible for the phenotype of deep trabeculation, dilated cardiomyopathy, and cardiac dysfunction, which resembles the phenotype of LVNC
